column4: I ran into a little problem, all of the themes in appearance prefs suddenly have no thumbnails. Everything is X, they work but you don't know what you're choosing. Anybody knows how to correct that?
did you install a theme recently?
do you know how to use a terminal?
if you downloaded something from gnome-look or a similar site recently it could be that
that's the only thing I get: (gnome-appearance-properties:1905): Gdk-CRITICAL **: gdk_display_sync: assertion `GDK_IS_DISPLAY (display)' failed
Something is wrong really because even starting appearance prefs eats up 3rd processor core at 100%
don't try to start it again - there must be a broken theme or engine
the process doesn't die when I close appearance prefs
and how did you correct it
how did you find it??? trial and error?
someone on the ubuntuforums site was able to find out which theme was the offending one and told me which one to remove
